title: Insert into List Function
description:
LIST_INSERT puts an element at the position POS in a list. The list consists
of Strings (elements) that begin with the separation character SEP. The
frst element of the list is at position 1. If a position greater than the last
element of the list is given, empty elements are added to the list until INS
is at its normal position at the end of the list. If POS = 0, the new element
will be placed to the top of the list.
name: LIST_INSERT

input.name: SEP
input.description: The separator byte used to tokenize the list.

input.name: POS
input.description: The position in the list where the new string should be inserted.

input.name: INS
input.description: The string that will be inserted into the list.

in/out.name: LIST
in/out.description: The list into which the string will be inserted.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE if the string was successfully inserted, otherwise FALSE.
